rev.diff:
Line 90: Line 90:
*'''November 2 (day 47)''' – Demonstrations continued in [[Occupy Oakland|Oakland]], California, with a citywide general strike taking place in response to the serious injury sustained by a protester on October 25.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2011/11/02/us/occupy-demonstrators/index.html?iref=allsearch|publisher=CNN|title=Demonstrators gear up for Oakland strike as protests continue|date=November 2, 2011|accessdate=November 2, 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-15481506|title=Occupy Oakland seeks strike after Scott Olsen injury|publisher=BBC|date=27 October 2011|accessdate=November 2, 2011}}</ref> Protesters shut down the [[Port of Oakland]], the nation's fifth busiest port.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nbcbayarea.com/news/local/Occupy-Oakland-Hosts-General-Strike-133081358.html|title=General Strike Shuts Down Port of Oakland|publisher=NBC|date=Nov 2, 2011 |accessdate=November 3, 2011}}</ref>
*'''November 2 (day 47)''' – Demonstrations continued in [[Occupy Oakland|Oakland]], California, with a citywide general strike taking place in response to the serious injury sustained by a protester on October 25.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2011/11/02/us/occupy-demonstrators/index.html?iref=allsearch|publisher=CNN|title=Demonstrators gear up for Oakland strike as protests continue|date=November 2, 2011|accessdate=November 2, 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-15481506|title=Occupy Oakland seeks strike after Scott Olsen injury|publisher=BBC|date=27 October 2011|accessdate=November 2, 2011}}</ref> Protesters shut down the [[Port of Oakland]], the nation's fifth busiest port.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nbcbayarea.com/news/local/Occupy-Oakland-Hosts-General-Strike-133081358.html|title=General Strike Shuts Down Port of Oakland|publisher=NBC|date=Nov 2, 2011 |accessdate=November 3, 2011}}</ref>
â
*'''November 3 (day 48)''' – Riot police fired tear gas and [[flash bang grenades]] on a large crowd of [[Occupy Oakland]] demonstrators that lit a massive bonfire in the streets of downtown Oakland.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/lanow/2011/11/occupy-oakland-tear-gas-arrests.html|publisher=LA Times|title=Riot police fire projectiles, arrest dozens of Occupy Oakland protester|date=November 3, 2011|accessdate=November 3, 2011}}</ref> Dozens of protesters were arrested.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.yahoo.com/occupy-oakland-protesters-tear-gased-police-101824932.html|title=Occupy Oakland Protesters Tear Gassed by Police|publisher=Yahoo News|date=November 3, 2011|accessdate=November 3, 2011}}</ref> [[Occupy Seattle]] protesters and police briefly clashed in protests sparked by Chase CEO [[Jamie Dimon]]'s visit to town. Five protesters were arrested for breaking into the bank, and two police officers sustained minor injuries. <ref>{{cite web|url=http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/nationnow/2011/11/occupy-seattle-chase-dimon.html|title=Occupy Seattle swoops in around JPMorgan Chase executive|publisher=Los Angeles Times|date=November 3, 2011|accessdate=November 3, 2011}}</ref>
+
*'''November 3 (day 48)''' – Riot police clashed with [[Occupy Oakland]], firing tear gas and [[flash bang grenades]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/lanow/2011/11/occupy-oakland-tear-gas-arrests.html|publisher=LA Times|title=Riot police fire projectiles, arrest dozens of Occupy Oakland protester|date=November 3, 2011|accessdate=November 3, 2011}}</ref> Over a hundred protesters were arrested, and including another Iraq veteran who was seriously injured by police.<ref>[http://abclocal.go.com/kgo/story?section=news/local/east_bay&id=8419771 Second veteran injured in 'Occupy Oakland' violence]</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.yahoo.com/occupy-oakland-protesters-tear-gased-police-101824932.html|title=Occupy Oakland Protesters Tear Gassed by Police|publisher=Yahoo News|date=November 3, 2011|accessdate=November 3, 2011}}</ref> [[Occupy Seattle]] protesters and police briefly clashed in protests sparked by Chase CEO [[Jamie Dimon]]'s visit to town. Five protesters were arrested for breaking into the bank, and two police officers sustained minor injuries. <ref>{{cite web|url=http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/nationnow/2011/11/occupy-seattle-chase-dimon.html|title=Occupy Seattle swoops in around JPMorgan Chase executive|publisher=Los Angeles Times|date=November 3, 2011|accessdate=November 3, 2011}}</ref>
*'''November 5 (day 50)''' – To participate in both [[Guy Fawkes Day]] and [[Bank Transfer Day]], demonstrators protested outside major banks and financial institutions. In the preceding month, over 600,000 people closed their bank accounts and opened accounts with local credit unions. <ref>{{cite web|url=http://inagist.com/OccupyLSX/132973217341120513/|title=600,000 Americans have moved their funds from banks to credit unions in the past month. The revolution is underway.|accessdate=7 November 2011}}</ref>
*'''November 5 (day 50)''' – To participate in both [[Guy Fawkes Day]] and [[Bank Transfer Day]], demonstrators protested outside major banks and financial institutions. In the preceding month, over 600,000 people closed their bank accounts and opened accounts with local credit unions. <ref>{{cite web|url=http://inagist.com/OccupyLSX/132973217341120513/|title=600,000 Americans have moved their funds from banks to credit unions in the past month. The revolution is underway.|accessdate=7 November 2011}}</ref>
